newsitem.title: USA: State Auto to acquire Midwest Security.
newsitem.headline: State Auto to acquire Midwest Security.

text.p: State Auto Financial Corp said on Tuesday it has signed a tentative deal to acquire Midwest Security Insurance Co of Onalaska, Wis., from R.W. Houser Inc.
The purchase price was not disclosed.
A definitive agreement is anticipated by November 1, 1996, with closing expected on or before January 6, 1997, the company said.

With the acquisition of Midwest Security, State Auto will enter Wisconsin, its 24th state of operation. Midwest Security's annual net written premium in 1995 was approximately $20 million, all of which was in personal property casualty insurance.
The acquisition is conditioned upon approval by the companies' boards of directors and regulators in Ohio and Wisconsin, State Auto said.
